reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here during the first leg of our trip to Argentina for 3 nights. I reserved the room through hojo.com. If you send them an e-mail, the hotel assisted us in arranging for transportation to pick us up at the international airport ($35-40 USD). Everything was easy and effortless. You can even exchange money with them (to pay the driver, for example) for convenience (note - there's a citibank ATM inside the international airport and another off Santa Fe street).
reviews.title: Nice Design, Very QUIET, Clean, Excellent Stay

reviews.text: There are only a few rooms (5-6 if I recall) on every floor. The hotel is off a quiet street, so if you are worried about "urban" noise, don't be. I am a very light sleeper and found the rooms to very very well insulated and quiet. In fact, one night, as we came home from dinner, I overheard the couple in the next room arguing as we approached our door. However, once we entered our room, I couldn't hear a thing!! For me, that deserves two thumbs up! Inside, the rooms are nicely designed and very on par in size with an above average American hotel. The free wi-fi access is great (there's a computer downstairs as well). There's also a small pool and a "gym" (if you consider one bicycle and one treadmill as a gym), which we saw but didn't use.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is available in the morning (not included and I forgot how much they charge) and the staff, who speaks excellent Engligh, can assist you with anything, such as booking a tango show (which we enjoyed) or calling a taxi for you.
reviews.title: Not your standard HJ as I knew it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though not super obvious as the area is more residential, there are a number of restaurants within walking distance, particularly along Santa Fe street 2 blocks away. One restaurant we found close by that we recommend is called Cumana. They are famous for cazuela, which is like a cassoulet. They also have good empanadas. For 2 people, we only spent a meager $30 USD, including 3 empanada appetizers, 2 entrees, dessert, wine, bottled water and 2 coffees (Note - Cash only, so be prepared). For a unique culinary experience, we found a closed door restaurant called Casa Saltshaker just a few streets over. You need to check in advanced for space since the "restaurant" is actually the chef's personal home (and he only hosts dinner a few nights per week).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good service and in a great location

reviews.text: Recoleta is a pretty "central" location in visiting other locations and I felt safe walking around at night compared to other areas. Taxis are pretty inexpensive and an approximate pricing was roughing 20-35 pesos one way (roughly $4-9 USD) either direction (west to Palermo Soho to east/southeast to Puerto Madero and San Telmo). Attractions within easy walking distance to this hotel include the Recoleta Cemetary and Museum of Fine Arts (across the street from the cemetary). On weekends, there is an open air market outside the cemetary selling things you can buy for souvenirs.
reviews.title: Perfecto!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we planned our honeymoon, we aimed for hotels at about an $80/night price point. This isn't one of them. HOWEVER... when you get a dud hotel about halfway through your trip, and you are starting to get tired, your dirty clothes are piling up, and you need something a bit more than a guesthouse... then you book a room here.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury in the heart of BA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It lives up to the TA reviews. It's very American style - easily the largest rooms we had on our entire trip. The beds are huge and the AC is cold. Breakfast was plentiful, and the welcome glass of wine was refreshing. The concierge was very helpful with booking a bike tour and calling taxis. The location is great - walking distance to most of central BA as well as great restaurants and shopping in Palermo Soho. It was the perfect way to end our honeymoon trip.
reviews.title: Quiet and Safe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My honey and I stayed four nights at the Boutique Recoleta. The hotel is on a quiet side street in the upscale Recoleta neighborhood, only four blocks from the famous Cementerio de la Recoleta where Evita Peron is buried. This hotel has a 3 star rating because it is small and does not have 5 star services. That is the only down side.
reviews.title: Great travel hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a oversized deluxe room, with a hydro, that overlooked Pena Street. Because we had only a king size bed in the room, it felt like a suite. The room was tastefully decorated and the bathroom and vanity area was upscale. The hotel offered free in-room wireless and had two two computers available for guests in the lobby. Our room had a flat screen LCD TV, small refrig, and remote climate control.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with excellent staff, facilities and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was more than helpful and provided daily suggestions of places for us to explore. We booked the room through www.booking.com and found a rate that was better than the hotel offered. Bottom line is - GREAT PLACE TO STAY in a world class, must see city!
reviews.title: The staff are perfecto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A smart and modern boutique hotel, the Howard Johnson Hotel Boutique Recoleta is in an excellent location just 10 minutes walk from tourist locations such as the Recoleta Cemetery. The staff are pleasant and keen to help, and the rooms clean and of a good size. The continental breakfast is quite extensive and augmented with scrambled eggs on request. Recommended (though be aware that the quoted rates do not always include taxes).
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in Recoleta, close to Av. Santa Fe, the cemetry, good restaurants etc. The rooms are exactly as the website shows, very spacious. We had a room with hydromassage spa - we didnt use it, as there is a fantastic pool downstairs. Breakfast is typical Argentinean fare (croissants, cakes, ham, cheese) but with some western twists with cereals, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed OJ and Grapefruit juice. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people coming to BA. They organised set-price transfers to-from the airport which was nice not to have to argue with queues etc after a long international flight. Beds are comfortable, TV - few movie channels (satelitte tv) with a few english choices. Rooms are quiet (only 4 rooms on our floor).
reviews.title: 5 star without the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, great service. reason for the 4 star was that they didnt really have an currency exchange available at the desk. We walked around the area looking for one. but overall it was a great hotel! nicely located and very safe!
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: This past August, my daughter and I stayed at the HJ Hotel Boutique Recoleta for several nights, and I knew when I returned to Buenos Aires in December I would without a doubt book another stay. Not only did I return with my daughter and husband, but also with a group of dear friends/family. We were a group of 8, and we all had a wonderful time. Buenos Aires is an amazing city, and the HJ Recoleta is in a perfect location. The hotel staff are the greatest! Everyone is so helpful and friendly and they are a major reason why this is a perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not sure what to expect from a Howard Johnson Hotel in Buenos Aires but we were glad we made the choice to stay there. The location was perfect for strolling down the streets of Recoleta out to Santa Fe Avenue. The staff was very helpful and always available. The rooms were modern, spacious and clean.
reviews.title: What a pleasant suprise in Buenos Aires!

reviews.text: Well located booutique hotel upgraded in recent years. Very clean with excellent staff. Good free breakfasts. Cafe serves light lunch and supper. Staff very helpful and more than willling to assist with event reservations, transport and tours. Not all taxis know of it so take address or, preferbly, a small map to assist. As safe a location as you are likely to find.
reviews.title: Can't go worng with this hotel

reviews.text: we stayed for a few days in December 2010.
reviews.title: absolutely a wonderful hotel!!,friendly english speaking staff
Awesome location, excellent service, definitely will stay there again!!!
reviews.text: From the moment that we were greeted by the friendly staff we felt very welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet, large ,spotless with two beautiful & comfortable queen sized beds, the extra large bathroom room even had a bidet.
reviews.title: Agree with all the other excellent reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is in the Recoleta area of Buenos Aires which is on of the nicest areas of this city .close to shopping transportation etc.
reviews.title: WALKED
